intro: Posoqueria correana, commonly known as the Florida evergreen fern, is a perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen fronds that remain green throughout the year. The plant features a short, creeping rhizome with clustered, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 15–30 cm in length. Posoqueria correana thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as an important component of wetland ecosystems.
